citations.narrative:
In the indoor portion of the facility a young rabbit had escaped the rabbit enclosure and was wandering in the shared area
of the inner room. Animals that escape the safety of their enclosure are at risk of injury or illness. Enclosures must be of
sturdy construction, maintained in good repair, and must safely contain the animals. The facility must ensure that the
rabbits can be kept in their designated enclosure.

There appears to be a lack of adequate pest control procedures at the facility. Large numbers of flies were observed
around the inside hedgehog enclosure and the outside serval enclosure. In the food storage area, there was a trash can
full of waste with no lid. There were numerous flies on and around this trash can and utensils being used to prepare food.
There were multiple trash cans located throughout the facility without lids. Open trash cans are an attractant to flies and
pests, and improper storage of waste can result in pest infestation and disease hazards. The licensee must create and
maintain an effective program for the control of pests to promote the health and comfort of the animals.
To be corrected by 11-4-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.50(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
In the indoor portion of the facility a young rabbit had escaped the rabbit enclosure and was wandering in the shared area 
of the inner room. Animals that escape the safety of their enclosure are at risk of injury or illness. Enclosures must be of 
sturdy construction, maintained in good repair, and must safely contain the animals. The facility must ensure that the 
rabbits can be kept in their designated enclosure. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
There appears to be a lack of adequate pest control procedures at the facility. Large numbers of flies were observed 
around the inside hedgehog enclosure and the outside serval enclosure. In the food storage area, there was a trash can 
full of waste with no lid. There were numerous flies on and around this trash can and utensils being used to prepare food. 
There were multiple trash cans located throughout the facility without lids. Open trash cans are an attractant to flies and 
pests, and improper storage of waste can result in pest infestation and disease hazards. The licensee must create and 
maintain an effective program for the control of pests to promote the health and comfort of the animals. 
 
To be corrected by 11-4-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
